title: T-shirts!
content:
i noticed that [Mark Simonson](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013235827/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Mark%252BSimonson) has a link to cafe press [on his webiste](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013235827/http:/www.cafepress.com/marksimonson) to order T-shirts. I was intrigued, so i did a bit of digging and found [http://www.printmojo.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013235827/http:/www.printmojo.com/ "http://www.printmojo.com"). Is anyone familiar with any similar services that offer a kind of screen on demand type thing? I’d be interested in finding out more...

 [‹ hess monoblack](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013235827/http:/typophile.com/node/13482 "Go to previous forum topic") [See your Kobe here! ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013235827/http:/typophile.com/node/13454 "Go to next forum topic")
author: paul d hunt

comments.content:
In Germany we have [http://www.spreadshirt.net](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013235827/http:/www.spreadshirt.net/ "http://www.spreadshirt.net").

Have a look to [gerrits shop example](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013235827/https:/www.spreadshirt.net/shop.php?sub=www.&target=shop.php&adelgade=barrell&sid=794).

BTW. It seems we have two kinds of typelovers. Someone that would never wear any cloths with letters, and the other ones loving it so much.

— [astype.de](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013235827/http:/www.astype.de/)—
